content: fdc will get us out of this pickle the final piece of the puzzle fortunately there is an answer all we have to do is get away from the idea that one motif must be completely finished before another one is started 11 too see what i mean and to finally prove that we have indeed found a solution to our challenge try this mini-project the following mini-project goes through how you would work 3 training wheels in a row using the breakaway crochet method 3 training wheels mini project for the first training wheel tw step 1 fdc step 2 7 double crochets into the ring at the base of the fdc just made pause work on the first tw and break away to the second tw step 3 repeat steps 1 and 2 pause work on the second tw and break away to the third tw step 4 fdc this third tw is at the end of the line so go ahead and finish it step 5 15 double crochets into the ring at the base of the fdc just made close the third tw step 5 slip_stitch between the second and third tw 12 finish off the second tw step 6 8 double crochets in the center ring of the second tw step 7 slip_stitch between the first and second tw finish off the first tw step 8 8 double crochets in the center ring of the first tw step 9 slip_stitch in the top of the first double_crochet fasten_off viola mission accomplished discussion even though you were dealing with little motifs that are traditionally worked in the round in this project it felt more like you were working back and forth in row that is you worked on a new motif until it was halfway finished and then progressed along the row to the next one the first row was finished when we got to the last motif at the end of the line by completing the last motif we automatically started going back the way we came this now gave us the opportunity to finish the rest of the motifs on this return row consequently this also meant that you did not have to turn the work as you usually do so the right side of the piece was always facing you this sequence will be very typical when you start working breakaway crochet projects it s also possible to add more row to this mini project if our aim was to create a rectangular-shaped piece instead of just a string of single motifs the training wheels project will show you how to do this 13 graduation project training wheels this final project will show you how to make a rectangular shaped mat comprising solely of the training wheels motif it will give you a good initiation into the world of breakaway crochet and since you will be making 130 training wheels it will provide you with plenty of practice making floating double crochets hint
